title: CDA, Bank of Punjab agree long-term partnership to facilitate financial transactions
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jun 28 (APP):The Capital Development Authority (CDA) and the Bank of Punjab have agreed on a long-term partnership to facilitate financial transactions.
During a meeting chaired by CDA Chairman, Muhammad Ali Randhawa, it was decided that the bank would play an active role in the upcoming Margalla tree plantation drive, scheduled for July 4 at the Jinnah Convention Centre, said a news release issued here on Friday.
The senior management from the bank attended the meeting and expressed their commitment to being a major partner in the tree plantation drive.
They also pledged to support the CDA in its efforts to restore the Margalla Hills and assist with other similar environmental initiatives.
The collaboration highlighted the importance of corporate involvement in environmental conservation and sustainable development projects.
